title: What is the best brand of car speakers? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not only the exterior looks, performance and milage, but also the interior design and even your car's stereo system also decides the eliteness of your car, and more importantly how much you care about it. There are a number of companies that manufacture a whole lot of speakers, but if you don't have the perfect blend of woofers, sub-woofers and vocals, it really can't deliver you a good driving experience. Here's a list of 10 such car speakers (arranged in increasing order of their price) that can really make a difference for your car's music system and can help you to make your friends really envious for your car ;) Kenwood KFC-6965S 3-Way Speakers Price: $38.12 or Rs 2720 Dimensions: 6 x 9 inches Weight: 2.11 kg Power Handling: 400W(peak) per pair Sensitivity: 92 dB Frequency Response: 30Hz to 22kHz 2. Kicker DS65 2-Way Car Speakers  Price: $45 or Rs 3210 Dimensions: 6.5 inch Weight: 2.1 kg Power Handling: 200W(peak) per pair Sensitivity: 90 dB Frequency Response: 40Hz to 20kHz 3. JBL GTO628 2-Way Car Speakers  Price: $50 or Rs 3570 Dimensions: 6.5 inch or 6.75 inch Weight: 2 kg Power Handling: 180W(peak) Sensitivity: 92 dB Frequency Response: 50Hz to 21kHz 4. Jaras JJ-2646 3-Way Car Speakers  Price: $50 or Rs 3570 Dimensions: 6.5 inch Weight: 1.7 kg Power Handling: 360W(peak) per pair 5. JVC CS-J620 2-Way Car Speakers  Price: $53 or Rs 3800 Dimensions: 6.5 inch Weight: 0.8 kg Power Handling: 300W(peak) per pair Sensitivity: 92 dB Frequency Response: 35Hz to 22kHz 6. Pioneer TS-A1675R 3-Way TS Series Car Speakers  Price: $80 or Rs 5700 Dimensions: 6.5 inch Weight: 1.7 kg Power Handling: 300W(peak) per pair Sensitivity: 90dB Frequency Response: 35Hz to 31kHz 7. Rockford Fosgate R165X3 3-Way Car Speakers  Price: $87 or Rs 6200 Dimensions: 6.5 inch Weight: 1.6 kg Power Handling: 180W (peak) per pair Sensitivity: 91 dB Frequency Response: 52Hz to 20kHz 8. BOSS Audio NX654 Onyx 6.5″ 4-Way Speakers  Price: $89 or Rs 6320 Dimensions: 6.5 inch Weight: 1.63 kg Power Handling: 400W (peak) per pair Sensitivity: 90 dB Frequency Response: 65Hz to 20kHz 9. Infinity Reference 6032CF 2-Way Car Speakers  Price: $120 or Rs 8565 Dimensions: 6.5 inch Weight: 2.3 kg Power Handling: 180W (peak) per pair Sensitivity: 93 dB Frequency Response: 53Hz to 21kHz 10. Alpine SPS-610C 2-Way Car Speakers  Price: $150 or Rs 10,700 Dimensions: 6.5 inch Weight: Power Handling: >250W (peak) per pair Sensitivity: 88 dB Frequency Response: 70Hz to 22kHz When going to buy a set of speakers for your car, always try to have more sensitivity, power handling capacity and frequency response for your audio system within your budget. There are other factors also, but these are the prime ones that you should be considering during your purchase.

There is not such a thing as the best car speakers for various reasons: What is good sound for you, may not be the same what for me is sound quality. You can get the most expensive loudspeakers in a car and they may still sound like crap  (Genesis) You can have the same set of speakers in two cars and they will probably sound completely different   (Scan Speak) There are plenty of high end audio brands, but you need to achieve the best "synergy" between your components and the the best positioning for the speakers, for each car, each case.   (Focal) If the source is of a lower quality, the speakers alone will actually do worst. The "better" the speaker, the more you will be able to notice the "imperfections" of the other components in your system.  (ZR Speaker Lab) I could be here for a long time posting brands like Morel, Dynaudio, Sonus Faber, Pioneer, McIntosh, Feastrex, Transmission Audio, Ground Zero, Audison, etc, etc... What you should do is listen to a few and buy the ones that will sound the best to YOU.
